result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Laura J. Carley was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laura J. Carley

defendant.name: Carley, Laura J.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laura J. Carley in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify sentence, Prison will ship her back to county jail to serve remainder of sentence..  DEF Counsel issue 210 county jail sentence, would have to increase to 1 year.   Court what does Ms Carley want, thought she would serve both sentences in Prison at once, and that is what McLaughlin had told her.   Mclaughlin moves to withdraw after Ms Carley's allegations.  Court grants withdrawl.   
Ms Carley is willing to proceed without counsel and wishes to proceed since time is sensitive.  PL given copy of motion by court,   Court reviewed transcripts and notes court did stop proceeding because court did not think the agreement could be carried out as intended.  Parties agreed agreement could be done as planned and now it appears it can not be carried out as planned.  
PL agrees that parties should come up with an agreement that best embodies the parties intentions.   Mistake of Fact and Law Motion Granted Modify sentence,  sentence modified to change conditional jail to 180 days concurrent with 12cf89 and give days credit of 176 days (time served) all other conditions remain.

Prior: 15568 Winter Drive, Hayward, WI 54843

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
